title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 428.15 - State board for historic preservation
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 428.15 - State board for historic preservation

State Regulations
(a) The board may review and comment in
writing to the commissioner on projects of its choosing which are being
reviewed by the commissioner. It may review and comment on environmental
assessments or statements submitted to it pursuant to subdivision (b) of
section
428.2
of this Part. In addition, the board may review and comment, as otherwise
provided by law, on undertakings where it appears that any aspect of the
undertaking may or will cause any change, beneficial or adverse, in the quality
of the historic, architectural, archaeological or cultural character that
qualifies an historic or cultural place for listing on the State

Register. (b) At the request of the
board, the commissioner shall provide the board with the PRDS and other
documentation relating to any project selected by it for review. (c) The board may submit its comments to the
commissioner for his consideration and inclusion in the record relating to the
project. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
428.15

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
